alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 7:31PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Morrow, north central Wheeler and southeastern Gilliam Counties through 815 PM PDT... At 731 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mayville, or 8 miles northeast of Fossil, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Condon and Mayville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon
